title: How to Use the Compass App on Your iPhone to Find Your Way

steps.title: Open your Compass app.
steps.content: Open your Compass app. If this app isn't on your Home Screen, you'll need to search for it in the App Library by swiping left on your phone until you scroll through all your Home Screen pages. The red arrow on the compass face will always be pointing North. The direction you are facing will appear in white below the compass face.

steps.title: Tap the compass face.
steps.content: Tap the compass face. This will lock in the bearing (degrees) that you want to travel in on your compass. A red circle will appear on your compass face when you are not following that path.

steps.title: Place your iPhone flat in your hand.
steps.content: Place your iPhone flat in your hand. The needle of your compass should stop moving.

steps.title: Spin around until your compass points in the direction you want to follow.
steps.content: Spin around until your compass points in the direction you want to follow. Slowly spin, watching the orientation of the compass face. This will help you maintain a sense of direction. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Open your Settings app.
steps.content: Open your Settings app. This is the app with the grey gears icon that can be found on your Home Screen.

steps.title: Tap on Apps > Compass.
steps.content: Tap on Apps > Compass . Your apps are listed alphabetically, so the Compass app will be in the "C" section.

steps.title: Tap Location.
steps.content: Tap Location . If you enable location services, the Compass app can tell you the elevation of your current location.

steps.title: Select While Using the App.
steps.content: Select While Using the App . Ensure Precise Location is toggled on as well.

steps.title: Open the Compass app.

steps.title: Locate your elevation at the bottom of the screen.
steps.content: Locate your elevation at the bottom of the screen. The app will list your current location and elevation.
